description: PhysicalMachineChaos is the Schema for the physical machine chaos API

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: Spec defines the behavior of a physical machine chaos experiment

address.description: DEPRECATED: Use Selector instead. Only one of Address and Selector could be specified.

clock-ids-slice.description: the identifier of the particular clock on which to act. More clock description in linux kernel can be found in man page of clock_getres, clock_gettime, clock_settime. Muti clock ids should be split with ","

time-offset.description: specifies the length of time offset.

path.description: specifies the location to fill data in. if path not provided, payload will read/write from/into a temp file, temp file will be deleted after writing

size.description: specifies how many units of data will write into the file path. support unit: c=1, w=2, b=512, kB=1000, K=1024, MB=1000*1000, M=1024*1024, GB=1000*1000*1000, G=1024*1024*1024 BYTES. example : 1M | 512kB

path.description: specifies the location to fill data in. if path not provided, payload will read/write from/into a temp file, temp file will be deleted after writing

payload-process-num.description: specifies the number of process work on writing, default 1, only 1-255 is valid value

size.description: specifies how many units of data will write into the file path. support unit: c=1, w=2, b=512, kB=1000, K=1024, MB=1000*1000, M=1024*1024, GB=1000*1000*1000, G=1024*1024*1024 BYTES. example : 1M | 512kB

path.description: specifies the location to fill data in. if path not provided, payload will read/write from/into a temp file, temp file will be deleted after writing

payload-process-num.description: specifies the number of process work on writing, default 1, only 1-255 is valid value

size.description: specifies how many units of data will write into the file path. support unit: c=1, w=2, b=512, kB=1000, K=1024, MB=1000*1000, M=1024*1024, GB=1000*1000*1000, G=1024*1024*1024 BYTES. example : 1M | 512kB

duration.description: Duration represents the duration of the chaos action

count.description: Count is the number of times to append the data.

data.description: Data is the data for append.

file-name.description: FileName is the name of the file to be created, modified, deleted, renamed, or appended.

dir-name.description: DirName is the directory name to create or delete.

file-name.description: FileName is the name of the file to be created, modified, deleted, renamed, or appended.

dir-name.description: DirName is the directory name to create or delete.

file-name.description: FileName is the name of the file to be created, modified, deleted, renamed, or appended.
FileName is the name of the file to be created, modified, deleted, renamed, or appended.

privilege.description: Privilege is the file privilege to be set.

dest-file.description: DestFile is the name to be renamed.

source-file.description: SourceFile is the name need to be renamed.

dest-string.description: DestStr is the destination string of the file.

file-name.description: FileName is the name of the file to be created, modified, deleted, renamed, or appended.

line.description: Line is the line number of the file to be replaced.

origin-string.description: OriginStr is the origin string of the file.

code.description: Code is a rule to select target by http status code in response

path.description: Match path of Uri with wildcard matches

port.description: The TCP port that the target service listens on

proxy_ports.description: Composed with one of the port of HTTP connection, we will only attack HTTP connection with port inside proxy_ports

code.description: Code is a rule to select target by http status code in response

delay.description: Delay represents the delay of the target request/response

path.description: Match path of Uri with wildcard matches

port.description: The TCP port that the target service listens on

proxy_ports.description: Composed with one of the port of HTTP connection, we will only attack HTTP connection with port inside proxy_ports

http-request.description: used for HTTP request, now only support GET

count.description: The number of requests to send

exception.description: the exception which needs to throw for action `exception`

pid.description: the pid of Java process which needs to attach

port.description: the port of agent server, default 9277

pid.description: the pid of Java process which needs to attach

port.description: the port of agent server, default 9277

latency.description: the latency duration for action 'latency', unit ms

pid.description: the pid of Java process which needs to attach

port.description: the port of agent server, default 9277

database.description: the match database default value is "", means match all database

exception.description: The exception which needs to throw for action `exception` or the exception message needs to throw in action `mysql`

latency.description: The latency duration for action 'latency' or the latency duration in action `mysql`

mysqlConnectorVersion.description: the version of mysql-connector-java, only support 5.X.X(set to "5") and 8.X.X(set to "8") now

pid.description: the pid of Java process which needs to attach

port.description: the port of agent server, default 9277

sqlType.description: the match sql type default value is "", means match all SQL type. The value can be 'select', 'insert', 'update', 'delete', 'replace'.

table.description: the match table default value is "", means match all table

pid.description: the pid of Java process which needs to attach

port.description: the port of agent server, default 9277

pid.description: the pid of Java process which needs to attach

port.description: the port of agent server, default 9277

rule-data.description: RuleData used to save the rule file's data, will use it when recover

cpu-count.description: the CPU core number need to use, only set it when action is stress

mem-type.description: the memory type need to locate, only set it when action is stress, the value can be 'stack' or 'heap'

pid.description: the pid of Java process which needs to attach

port.description: the port of agent server, default 9277

reloadCommand.description: The command to reload kafka config

mode.description: Mode defines the mode to run chaos action. Supported mode: one / all / fixed / fixed-percent / random-max-percent

egress-port.description: only impact egress traffic to these destination ports, use a ',' to separate or to indicate the range, such as 80, 8001:8010. it can only be used in conjunction with -p tcp or -p udp

hostname.description: only impact traffic to these hostnames

ip-address.description: only impact egress traffic to these IP addresses

ip-protocol.description: only impact traffic using this IP protocol, supported: tcp, udp, icmp, all

percent.description: percentage of packets to corrupt (10 is 10%)

source-port.description: only impact egress traffic from these source ports, use a ',' to separate or to indicate the range, such as 80, 8001:8010. it can only be used in conjunction with -p tcp or -p udp

accept-tcp-flags.description: only the packet which match the tcp flag can be accepted, others will be dropped. only set when the IPProtocol is tcp, used for partition.

egress-port.description: only impact egress traffic to these destination ports, use a ',' to separate or to indicate the range, such as 80, 8001:8010. it can only be used in conjunction with -p tcp or -p udp

hostname.description: only impact traffic to these hostnames

ip-address.description: only impact egress traffic to these IP addresses

ip-protocol.description: only impact traffic using this IP protocol, supported: tcp, udp, icmp, all

jitter.description: jitter time, time units: ns, us (or µs), ms, s, m, h.

latency.description: delay egress time, time units: ns, us (or µs), ms, s, m, h.

source-port.description: only impact egress traffic from these source ports, use a ',' to separate or to indicate the range, such as 80, 8001:8010. it can only be used in conjunction with -p tcp or -p udp

dns-domain-name.description: map this host to specified IP

dns-ip.description: map specified host to this IP address

dns-server.description: update the DNS server in /etc/resolv.conf with this value

duration.description: NIC down time, time units: ns, us (or µs), ms, s, m, h.

egress-port.description: only impact egress traffic to these destination ports, use a ',' to separate or to indicate the range, such as 80, 8001:8010. it can only be used in conjunction with -p tcp or -p udp

hostname.description: only impact traffic to these hostnames

ip-address.description: only impact egress traffic to these IP addresses

ip-protocol.description: only impact traffic using this IP protocol, supported: tcp, udp, icmp, all

percent.description: percentage of packets to duplicate (10 is 10%)

source-port.description: only impact egress traffic from these source ports, use a ',' to separate or to indicate the range, such as 80, 8001:8010. it can only be used in conjunction with -p tcp or -p udp

duration.description: The number of seconds to run the iperf test

ip-address.description: Generate traffic to this IP address

parallel.description: The number of iperf parallel client threads to run

port.description: Generate traffic to this port on the IP address

rate.description: The speed of network traffic, allows bps, kbps, mbps, gbps, tbps unit. bps means bytes per second

egress-port.description: only impact egress traffic to these destination ports, use a ',' to separate or to indicate the range, such as 80, 8001:8010. it can only be used in conjunction with -p tcp or -p udp

hostname.description: only impact traffic to these hostnames

ip-address.description: only impact egress traffic to these IP addresses

ip-protocol.description: only impact traffic using this IP protocol, supported: tcp, udp, icmp, all

percent.description: percentage of packets to loss (10 is 10%)

source-port.description: only impact egress traffic from these source ports, use a ',' to separate or to indicate the range, such as 80, 8001:8010. it can only be used in conjunction with -p tcp or -p udp

accept-tcp-flags.description: only the packet which match the tcp flag can be accepted, others will be dropped. only set when the IPProtocol is tcp, used for partition.

direction.description: specifies the partition direction, values can be 'from', 'to'. 'from' means packets coming from the 'IPAddress' or 'Hostname' and going to your server, 'to' means packets originating from your server and going to the 'IPAddress' or 'Hostname'.

hostname.description: only impact traffic to these hostnames

ip-address.description: only impact egress traffic to these IP addresses

ip-protocol.description: only impact egress traffic to these IP addresses

process.description: the process name or the process ID

recoverCmd.description: the command to be run when recovering experiment

percent.description: Specifies maxmemory as a percentage of the original value

requestNum.description: The number of requests to be sent

flushConfig.description: The control flag determines whether to flush config
The control flag determines whether to flush config

remoteCluster.description: RemoteCluster represents the remote cluster where the chaos will be deployed

selector.description: Selector is used to select physical machines that are used to inject chaos action.

annotationSelectors.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to select objects. A selector based on annotations.

expressionSelectors.description: a slice of label selector expressions that can be used to select objects. A list of selectors based on set-based label expressions.

items.description: A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

fieldSelectors.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to select objects. A selector based on fields.

labelSelectors.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to select objects. A selector based on labels.

namespaces.description: Namespaces is a set of namespace to which objects belong.

physicalMachines.description: PhysicalMachines is a map of string keys and a set values that used to select physical machines. The key defines the namespace which physical machine belong, and each value is a set of physical machine names.

load.description: specifies P percent loading per CPU worker. 0 is effectively a sleep (no load) and 100 is full loading.

workers.description: specifies N workers to apply the stressor.

size.description: specifies N bytes consumed per vm worker, default is the total available memory. One can specify the size as % of total available memory or in units of B, KB/KiB, MB/MiB, GB/GiB, TB/TiB..

attackCmd.description: The command to be executed when attack

recoverCmd.description: The command to be executed when recover

value.description: Value is required when the mode is set to `FixedMode` / `FixedPercentMode` / `RandomMaxPercentMode`. If `FixedMode`, provide an integer of physical machines to do chaos action. If `FixedPercentMode`, provide a number from 0-100 to specify the percent of physical machines the server can do chaos action. IF `RandomMaxPercentMode`,  provide a number from 0-100 to specify the max percent of pods to do chaos action

vm-name.description: The name of the VM to be injected

status.description: Most recently observed status of the chaos experiment

conditions.description: Conditions represents the current global condition of the chaos

experiment.description: Experiment records the last experiment state.

containerRecords.description: Records are used to track the running status

events.description: Events are the essential details about the injections and recoveries

message.description: Message is the detail message, e.g. the reason why we failed to inject the chaos

operation.description: Operation represents the operation we are doing, when we crate this event

timestamp.description: Timestamp is time when we create this event

type.description: Type means the stage of this event

injectedCount.description: InjectedCount is a counter to record the sum of successful injections

recoveredCount.description: RecoveredCount is a counter to record the sum of successful recoveries
